content:
Validator 3 had an extra newline after the input, which I've now removed.

These can be super annoying in shortest mode clashes, where you get 100% without removing newlines in the clash so you save a few chars and hit submit only to find you get 80% on validators. :/

Previously was:
"10
3 -5 8 9 -9 10 42 -20 -20 40
"
Now:
"10
3 -5 8 9 -9 10 42 -20 -20 40"

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nicely done

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple & Clear : Nice :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The task is clear, the tests cover evry possibility.
The solution is complex but not difficult.

I would love to see this especially in shortest mode.
I like your clash, it is simple and easy to do.
I like it! Very simple and to the point. Would be fun for the beginners who are looking for simple clashes!

Goal section
* The meaning is unclear and does not specify all requirements. Suggest to rewrite the first sentence as:
Calculate the average of the array values, and output the value in the array at the index which is equal to the rounded down value of the average. In this clash, the array is 0-indexed.
* Please format ERROR as a {{constant}}.

Input section and Output section
* Please follow the example in the contribution guidelines to present these two sections, e.g. including line numbers and variable types.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines
* For [[L]] please specify that it contains [[n]] space-separated integers.
* Please include the possibility of outputting {{ERROR}} in Output section.

Constraints section
* Please write "elements of [[L]]" instead of "[[L]].
* Some of your cases have violated the second constraint. Please revise the constraint so that negative numbers and zero are allowed as inputs.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.
Thanks for your help ! I think I fixed everything.
